page.title: 05CUSTOMS AND TRADITIONS (i)
page.content: {A New Tradition Established - The {Two Hills Foot Race }on Meldon and Nattadon Hills. Inaugurated by the Silver Jubilee Committee in 1977 as part of Chagford's celebrations, the coursew runs from the Jubilee Field to the Common,then up the face and down the side,first of Meldon, then of Nattadon before finishing back along New Street to the Jubilee field, a distance of 3.25 miles with a total ascent of 1055 feet.The first race attracted some 40 entries and was won by a local boy,Barry Knight. In 1978 the Carnival Committee took over the organisation and new trophies were donated for special groups of contestant.Now held at Whitsun it has become widely known with over 90 runners in 1985 coming from Cornwall to Cumbria.
